review: I visit here often and really enjoy the appetizer menu. They have great burgers and the long Island I've teas are on the money.  This is not find dining but a cool alternative.  I also life the chicken brushetta pasta very tasty.

This location honestly gives all the other Friday's restaurants a bad rep. I've been to quite a few here and there. This one in particular is probably THE WORST one to go to. The service is horrible. The servers could care less about your needs and are extremely slow. First time going I got myself a rib rack. It was burnt to a crisp, to the point of being not edible. The second, and last time I will ever go there, I ordered a burger. It was very slow that day, so I was expecting to at least have my meal in a decent time. NOPE. The appetizer (nachos) still took about half an hour by itself. And the entree (burger) took another half hour after that. In that time, our server only came to us to bring the food. Never to see if we needed anything. Seeing as I sat for half an hour waiting for a plate of nachos to come out, I went through my drink before it had arrived. That said, the server didn't even ask if I wanted a refill. Just a quick plop of the plate on the table, and back to chatting to her coworkers she went. Needless to say, never again. Had to give one star because I can't go any lower..

What happened to this place. As soon as I walked in the place had a smell like if they washed the floors with sewage water. Waited 10 minutes to see someone to take us to the table. I went to the bathroom and on front of the door there was a huge puddle of water, bathroom was dirty. I them sit and another 15 minutes to wait for service. The food horrible and ribs were and tasted like it was frozen and defrosted 20 hundred times. Oh and the utensiles were dirty dirty dirty.  Never again. I didnt return the food cause they might spit on it.
The food was great, especially the half off appetizers but we only saw our server 3 times & we had to flag her down 2 of those times. Service could use a lot of improvement.

I was disappointed in my last visit but when I called Mike he told us to return with complimentary coupons for appetizers/desert. Well it doesn't hurt to give them another chance... Right? So far everything is going well....

Worst customer service in the world, 20 minutes for a table for 3, then 20 minutes sitting at the table waiting for a server and 25 minute later still no server. This place has gone down hill since it's opening. Stay away better off eating at Longhorns...

Me and my boyfriend both love this place especially on Fridays during happy hours. If you are here to get a five star meal then this isn't the restaurant you want to go to. If you are in the mood for appetizers and dessert type foods then this is totally your place. I would highly suggest to go during happy hours because appetizers are half off. Their boneless wings, fries, spinach dip, and cheesecake are amazing. I never get any entrees here but if you are in the mood, I would suggest to get the boneless steak that is marinated with garlic, it's great!

I know it's a Fridays, and so I try to keep my expectations in check. I have to say, though, that the service was my main complaint. The food was good, but our waitress was fairly apathetic. We didn't get utensils with our food, and she vanished immediately after delivering it, forcing us to have to flag down another one. We didn't see her much again for the duration of our meal, and for some time after, even as we sat waiting to order dessert. When she came back, she seemed eager to give us the check, and surprised that we wanted to order more. With any luck, it was just a fluke, or a result of choosing to sit at a table in the noisy bar area rather than wait for one in the proper dining section. It won't stop me from going back, but with Houlihan's a short drive away, and Longhorn Steakhouse in the same plaza, I've certainly got other choices if I should be in the mood for a chain restaurant.

I do not normally go to TGI. However, at the request of a graduate, this restaurant was chosen. I was excited to order a meal that I haven't tried which was the Pecan Crusted Salad. It was noted in the menu that it was a favorite to other. So I felt relieved in ordering it. Now, the restaurant was empty and the waiter was very confident in his customer service which was refreshing. But that refreshing moment did not last. There were mistakes made. One being the wait time for the food was not right because no one was around. Second was the service checking in on the customers. Third was the food being mediocre and the pecan crusted chicken being cold. I asked for them to warm it up. Rather than warm and make it again, they warmed it in the microwave. Which made the chicken tougher than what it was and looked inedible. My company always says I have issues with restaurants but if you are paying for food that you aren't cooking, shouldn't it be good and you should be satisfied with it? This franchise needs to change to keep its locals coming back to the business...

I had to wait nearly 20 minutes simply to be greeted by a hostess and seated. That alone is a reason to give a low review, but when I got my meal it was about half the size of something that I could get in a better restaurant. I also got a dirty look from the waitress when I didn't leave a tip as a result of this bad experience. I was already hungry again by the time I got home.
This place is ghetto !! The service sucks. Try hiring people who care and actually want to work.  Food is average. The worst TGIF that I have ever been to.

This TGIF is one of the worst I have been to. It is generic chain food and the service is horrendous. I have been here on 4 occasions since it opened and I either leave here feeling 'meh' or disappointed.  Let me tell you about my last experience...  First, I only went because I had a gift card to use. My husband and I went on a Sunday evening and it was not busy at all. Usually there is a crowd of people waiting to be seated. When we walked in, the hostess was not at her station.  We stood there for literally 5 minutes. A girl walks over to the hostess station, doesn't even acknowledge us, & proceeds to refill the crayon bin. We awkwardly stand there for another few minutes just kind of looking at her. Finally I say, 'Excuse me, Are you the hostess'? and she nods. I hold up my hand and say, 'Two, please' and she says ...... 'I know.' ( WTF) and goes back to restocking the crayons. After she was done, she finally seated us.  The place was pretry empty, only a few tables and as we were being seated, I couldn't help but notice dirty tables throughout the entire restaurant - at least 5 with empty plates of food left on them. Disgusting.  When our waitress comes over, she takes our drink order... brings me my selzter right away but doesn't bring my husbands beer for 10 minutes. Another waiter came by, introduced himself, & also asked for our drink order. They had to figure out who was going to get our table. Our waitress kept grabbing our glasses by the rim of the cup (my husband pointed it out - pretty unsanitary).  The food was generic chain food - nothing that spectacular.   After my last experience,  I am pretty sure I will never be returning to this place (unless it is to visit the bar and eat unhealthy appetizers, which would be rare, but is probably all this place is good for if you fancy that type of stuff).

Most places have complaints about the service or the quality of the food but my complaint is different.  I enjoyed the service, no problems with the staff.  While the food did taste good, the portions were ridiculously small. I was with a party of 4 who all ordered different meals and everyone of us agreed that our meals were extremely small. My bacon cheeseburger had once single slice of bacon on the enormous bun that was way to big for the tiny burger. After we ate we ordered dessert which came in a timely manner, but again it was the size of the quarter cent brownies you get at the corner store and it had a half of spoonful of ice cream on it.
Second time I've come here and the food takes forever to get to my table. The portionsare very small to nonexistant. The waitress was nice and friendly.

Not good, not completely and utterly terrible. but certainty not good. The entire setup of the restaurant is very awkward. The food was pretty bad, I'd rather eat a Fridays microwave dinner then go to the actual restaurant again.  Definitely would not go back.

Food here is terrible and service is one step below burger king...stay away.. Out of 3 sets of silverware I got 3 dirty knives and the menu was covered in a sticky substance that I can only hope originated as some type of food substance. If you like dog food and enjoy listening to gangsta rap blasted in your ear while you eat this place is for you.

When last night for dinner for the second time.  I was quickly reminded why I had only been once before.  The food was horrible.  I should have left as soon as the appetizer was brought to the table, but I chanced it.  It did not get any better.  Never going back to this location & I will think twice about any other Fridays location.

When this place opened it was decent but has slowly gone downhill.  I really enjoy the cheap beers/food during happy hour and is probably the only time that I will come.  I find often that the bartenders try hard but I have waited on several occasions for over 10 minutes just to get a refill on my beer or to even get my order taken.  I have been to other fridays and this one isn't good quality.

Tonight was not a winner! My chicken was rubbery and was chewing me back, the rest of my party had cold food. The chef was mad I sent my food back but he was the one that didn't prepare it right in the first place. I sent it back and the party I chewed was reheated and put back on my plate! At least the bread was good since I had to fill up on that!

initial visit was poor to say the least...I called manager Eric who kindly offered me a complimentary entree for my next visit..I told him I was no\t interested ion coming back..I wanted to really tune him up regarding his staff's poor performance. He kept his cool and thanked me for my input and we hung up. Because its a local business I gave it another shot a month later without calling Eric...To my pleasant surprise all was great Have been back multiple times and will continue to patronize location

So it takes a lot for me to give a place anything less than a neutral 3 star rating. This place has gone down hill quicker than a fat kid on ice down a 80 degree slope. This is our go to spot when we are in Bayonne and want something to eat. Usually during their happy hour. When the place first opened up, it was on point. Refills came without being asked for, food was on point and staff was awesome. Nowadays, people walk around with just a tee shirt on, practicing juggling behind the bar with the fake bottle or just have you wondering where your waiter/waitress is.  We come in, hostess greets us and we ask to sit at the bar because of Happy Hour and half price apps and see tells us to choose our seat as usual and we do. So we sit down, utensils are on the table ready for use BUT the table was as sticky as the underside of a high school cafeteria table. There were still some leftovers from the previous patron as well and we were given no menus.  Beforehand, our waitress is walking past us as we are walking to our table to what I'm assuming is another one of her tables and I'm assuming they were either another pair of regulars like ourselves or friends. She was talking with them for over 15 minutes. I'm saying our waitress, because there was no one else waiting tables in that section and there were only 5 tables being used and about 5 people at the bar side with their drinks and food, but the bartender I know waits those there. We waited about 10 of those minutes cause we weren't in a rush as it was the end of our day, but we are thinking, man we haven't even been offered a menu let alone a glass of water! So I suggest we sit bar side, but guess what?! We hadn't seen the bartender since we came into the establishment either! So we contemplated what should we do for 5 minutes and my gf said eh let's give them 2 minutes before we just leave. I turned to her and said nope, we are leaving. We got up and started walking out and the same hostess sends us out with a thank you for coming, hope you had a good meal and we respond by telling her we would've had to been served first in order to have a meal first, let alone a good meal.  So we left and went to 5 Guys. Where they actually enjoy making money and pleasing their customers.
Omg! The service on this location is extremely slow!!! It doesnt even deserve a star uggggh!

Staff is very slow, many times i cane in to a bar area and tables around it are dirty some stayed dirty untill i actually finished leaving. Bartenders barely come around to ask if i want anything else. Hard to get their attention. Alsox you can hear people from the kitchen being all loud and yelling
The food was mediocre, on a sizzling chicken and shrimp they used sliced cheese .  Jack Daniels wings were good. Mashed potatoes had a hard outter shell
Love this place. Fast food, but good food and service. Great prices. Nice date​ place . 5 stars all the way.

Ok so I have never left a review in my life... but tonight I feel like I need to write a review! We sat at the bar area not crowded service was slow, plates were not cleared. I witnessed people leaving because the service was so bad. It's Friday's for gods sakes shouldn't that be one if the busiest days and staffed correctly ? Apparently from other reviews it seems like the norm. This location is not staffed correctly and will continue to suffer.  The bartender is super sweet but she was making the drinks for the tables as well as the bar because the "second bartender" was pulled to help host a 20 person party ... whatever. He was more interested in pleasing the ladies if you catch my drift. Next time we will try Houlihan's....

Not bad happy hour prices. The unlimited apps are a steal at $12. Started off with a PBR tall boy. $4.10 isn't too bad. Ordered the first app, the Braised Beef Nachos (forget exactly what they're called, but they were essentially nachos). Came with 4 round crispy tortillas with meet, cheese, and slaw. Not bad, but not the best nachos I've ever had. Probably would not order these as a stand alone app. Moved on to the green been fries. I enjoyed these. Though I regret eating as many as I did by myself. The sauce on the side is alright (wasabi mayo?)... ended up going ketchup with extra pepper instead. Ordered my second beer - Lagunitas IPA (large). Not bad pricing, but definitely more expensive than the PBR. 3rd ap: Boneless wings. Tasted really good, maybe a little too salty and the memphis bbq was a little too sweet for my liking. The sriracha buffalo is a little more my speed (I've had these in the past at this location). Avoid the PBJ wings like the plague (again, something I had once ordered in the past at this location). And finally the 4th ap: The Tuscan Spinach dip. Really tasty, the dip at least. Some of the chips weren't crispy and were kind of oily as if they were cooked in oil that wasn't quite hot enough. At this point I wasn't hungry enough to ask for them to be replaced. I only ate about a 1/4 of this before I finished my meal. Overall, decent. You should understand that when you go to Friday's you're getting an upscale "fast food". I wouldn't be surprised if not a single one of these apps didn't go from frozen to the fryer to my plate. With that understanding, Friday's does a pretty good job of this, and for really reasonable prices.

I don't like giving bad reviews, but this was horrible service. went there on Labor Day and it was not even really busy. No one came to our table for about 10 minutes. Then we saw that there was a kiosk where we had to request a server. We waited another 15 minutes and no one showed up. Mind you it's not even busy!! I've been here before and although the food is not that great, the service has always been OK. I've never had this experience anywhere. Probably will never go here again or maybe for a very long time.

place sucks---from the service to the wait time-to placing an order on the phone got passed to 3 different people to order ribeye and ribs..oh yea the 2nd person had no idea what a RIBEYE was are you kidding me

I'm literally writing this review while sitting in Houlihan's.  That's a start. I recently went to TGI Fridays, (about 15 minutes ago) me and my husband were seated, we sat for 10 minutes waiting to be asked to order drinks, forget about the food, we weren't even asked to order drinks. What made us leave was two things: 1) it's empty in the restaurant, so what's taking so long? 2) there were two guys who were seated 5 minutes after us, and at the 10th minute of us waiting, they received their drinks So we walked out. As we walked out, the hostess looked at us, didn't question us, didn't greet us or say good-bye, nothing. Also, clearly the manager doesn't work Sunday's because there was a guy with tattoos serving tables, not in uniform, how professional?  Black t-shirt, baggy blue jeans, and tattoos all out, come on.  Never again.

I normally don't like fast food type restaurants but TGI Fridays' sizzling chicken and shrimp entree is fantastic. It is probably due to the layer of melting cheese on the bottom of plate underneath the chicken and shrimp that makes it so good. This dish probably is not good for heart health but so good; we ate every bite. Also, surprisingly their ahi tuna crisps are very good too!

I really don't get it, we come in no host/hostess waited a few min, finally had to go find someone to seat us. Should have turned around and left, but didn't. Sat in the dining area service was terrible , too long to get drinks, had to ask multiple times. Had to go get napkins and small plates myself and it goes on and on. Check came and it was incorrect, server was clueless , had to get the manager, he corrected it. I want to like this place its near home and the food is decent.

It took at least 20 minutes after we sat down before someone came over to take our drink and food orders. When the food finally came out about 35 minutes later the broccoli was cold. Not to mention the waitress never came back to refill my water. I sat there thirsty as heck the entire time.  She had to be flagged down for the check

WORST FREAKING SERVICE I HAVE EVER SEEN HERE!!! WAITED 20 MINS FOR A WAITER AND THEY NEVER CAME I saw a manager and told him I waited and it a problem and he said he'll send someone over and my boyfriend and father just said let's leave. As we walked out we spotted the manager once again and told him we're leaving and he never apologize  What kind of chain restaurant are you who doesn't care about their customers! ? A crappy one!

1 star only because I have to. It's 11 on a Sunday and they closed at 12. A table of 6 I was with had the waitress Marissa or Chrissy because I'm sure she lied about her name, she's the short, fair skin female with long hair and dyed purple hair on the ends, was very rude taking our order because it was "late" and she said "you should have came earlier" after the group of us ordered. No way in any establishments have I been spending money especially a group of six and be disrespected or rushed after ordering food and drinks . Save your money for better service unless it's Quincy who is the shorter dark skin bartender/waiter who is so kind and professional and cool! thank you Quincy!!!! I will only come here for Quincy!

Ordered cheeseburger sliders, which come with an order of 3 sliders. They literally cooked a regular size hamburger patty and cut it into 3rds and put it on each little bun. I mean I don't expect much from fridays but this actually made me laugh So much effort!

I almost did not go to this TGIFs in Bayonne because of the spate of negative reviews I saw posted here. But I went anyway and wow, I found the very opposite: I was very pleasantly surprised by the nicely maintained decor and atmosphere of the place, the excellent service, and the just as excellent food. We shared the Sesame Jack Chicken Strips, which were absolutely delicious. I had a very tasty Veggie Burger. Service was quick, very friendly. Bathrooms were spotless, too.  I can't imagine what the whiney complainers were writing about. It was a very pleasant experience and I would go to this TGIFs again in a heartbeat.

My most recent visit here was not at all what I had hoped it would be. Our waitress was terrible! She did several things that made our experience unpleasant: - she took almost 20 mins to even come greet us after we were seated - she complained of being tired and said that her feet were hurting so she grabbed a chair, plopped down in it and tried to hand her notepad to my friends and have each of us individually write down our food and drink orders - she got very disrespectful when my friend said that she couldn't taste any Jack Daniels' sauce on her burger and asked for more - when we asked her for more napkins for the table, it took her 15 mins to bring 3 napkins to a party of 6 (I guess she wanted us to share) - after bringing our food and drinks, she stayed away from our table for a very long time, up until we were ready pay - once we asked for the check, she kept coming back to the table multiple times to let us know how much the tip should be and how we could put the tip on a gift card, credit, or cash - before handing us the check, she wrote on our receipt by circling the area that says "20% tip gratuity" and she sat down at a nearby table watching and listening to us as we were discussing how much we should tip her Every single Friday's I've ever been to seem to be competing with one another to see can offer the worst service. The food isn't that bad but the service sucks. Too bad I can't give 0 stars.

Ok the food here is alright. The menu is a little too out there for me I like simple things only because I don't think anyone can mess up a simple plate. What I ordered was two beers side of fries and two orders of their buffalo wings. Wings were okay nothing crazy but the service there is the only thing bad about this tgif. I waited about 20 minutes before someone came to my rescue. I went there for a quick bite for lunch around 1 and I couldn't leave until 245 just because of how slow they are. I mean really the moment we sat down we knew what we wanted it just takes them forever. Also they'll have you waiting in the front until they figure out who's the host to sit us down. It's a joke . But like I said the fries and wings were fine. I guess that's what counts right ?

Well, I went here tonight since the kids insisted (it's their favorite place). We had the unlimited appetizers for the first time ($10 for all you can eat of any one of 6 different appetizers). My son had the boneless chicken wings & was able to switch back & forth between the various flavors (bbq, jack daniels, buffalo) every time he asked for more. I had the mozzarella sticks & farnkly, there are only so many of those you can eat, so I'm not sure it was worth it for me. My little guy had his favorite of course - mac 'n cheese which he inhaled! The best part of the evening was our server, Q, who was professional, friendly, interacted with my kids, & even got me to order dessert (which I never do here since the food is so calorie laden to start with). My boys devoured the brownie sundae, but luckily I was able to taste one bite of the brownie - which for someone like me who LOVES chocolate, it was amazing. While the food is your regular chain food, the servers overall & specifically Q elevate this to a 5 star experience, particulary if you want to grab a quick bite with friends or if you're taking the kiddies out.  Overall, the unlimited appetizer deal is good if you order the boneless wings AND if others in your party also order this promo, so that you can all share.  Make sure to sign up for the Stripes Rewards program, & ask for free chips & salsa every time you go. They will also email you coupons for money off, free items, & even my favorite a "Jump The Line" pass, which allows you to come in & skip the entire line of people waiting for tables & be seated immediately - now that's VIP service!

I've had Fridays in other towns and this place doesn't compare. Wait is horrendous, staff is non responsive, food is cheap but quality is way below par. Don't waste your time, go to a local eatery and you'll have a better time.

Listen I love Fridays but there's this one waitress that made me so angry. Me my dad and grandparents went one night we ordered our entrees and she disappears until she brings everything to our table (only once she came to fill our drinks). Then when she brings our food to the table and leaves I realize my breadsticks didn't come. And I'm looking for her I don't see her for about 8min. She then comes to our table I say my breadsticks didn't come and she then says why didn't you tell me. Are you kidding me. I wanted to say to her excuse me first of all don't blame me for you not doing your second how can I tell you job if never come by and ask are you guys ok or is the food good. I hope i don't see her ever again in that restaurant
Tables are always dirty in the bar area, and we have to wait to sit. Food is okay for what it is. Management needs to pay better attention.

Stay away from this place at all cost the staff here is a horror show I've been to this place 3 times thinking every time it will be better it was not that is not enough room here to put everything that is wrong with this place the last time I went Sat 15 minutes wait staff was in the corner talking got up and left. last time I will be going here
Went again after a year and was hoping for the best. Rotten service, watered down drinks, lousy wait staff from the hood. Stay away.
After waiting 45 minutes for a table, the service was horrible and the portions were so small that even I was still hungry after eating.  I usually only eat half of my meal, so that's pretty bad.

The place is pretty good. Location is kind of secluded, not much else around. But the food was good and it really was everything I expect from a Fridays, it isn't an upscale restaurant...it's a Fridays! I got my food at a decent time and service was good

Do not go here.  Friday night 610 pm. Show up with wife and kids looking for a good meal. Met by 15 people at door waiting. Oh well so be it I thought.  Then I notice all the disgruntled people expressions.  Guy tells me he's waiting 30 minutes after they told him five.  Then notice place is half empty.  Asked the hostess and she said they have no servers to wait tables.   Amazing.   On Friday night and they have no workers and a line out the door.  Horrible management.  All but two people walked out and left.  We will not be back to this location

If based on food alone I would give a solid 4 stars and on a good day, 5 stars . I love the happy hour, 50% off apps 3pm-7pm and10pm-close in the bar, all day Sunday all over the restaurant. Who can beat it? But there's one thing in my way. The horrible service. Now I've had some nice ones particularly the guys, especially the tallest one he's awesome but some of they're workers are straight out the ghetto hood rats. There's one girl who wears super short dresses showing her cellulite, so you know who she is. She was so rude and her service was awful. She's the type that if you piss her off, she'll probably spit in your food. Some of us ordered apps as meals and others got burgers, we asked for them to be served at the same time. She did it separately anyway so our table were all eating at different times, we asked her why this happened and she denied that we ever asked for it to be served that way. She served us and charged us for a meal that we canceled. She again denied that we canceled it. She didn't give us napkins, so we tried to get her attention, we hear yelling from behind the bar. Apparently our waitress and 3 others were back there telling some story, acting ghetto, and cursing. My mother walks back there and then she came acting like we were bothering her. She gave us attitude the whole time. Honestly I come to fridays only cuz of this deal but my stomach turns when I see that she's our server. Please fire her! We're in a tough economy and many people need jobs and then I see snobby ratchet hood rats treating customers like crap and that's when I feel someone better could fill that position. 5 star food! 0 stars for that crappy waitress.

we usually come here for HAPPY HOUR  1/2 $ appetizer & cocktails   (we  The tuna crisp appetizers & bbq flatbread  ). however; Service today was horrible.  our server  ADRIANE was awful, we waited 20min before She came  to take our drinks orders. Then waited another 20min to get our drinks delivered. even more annoying was that we were sitting facing the bar and we were able to see her standing by the bar chatting &giggling with other servers. After we got the drinks & half of our food ( which she didn't delivered),  then She  disappeared  without checking on us. So everything else that was needed we had to ask to other servers.   Then She came back when we were done and ready to leave asking us to pls. Fill a survey and in exchange she will give us a free appetizer. ... and rate her service with as amazing    IF YOU GIVE ME A REVIEW WITH A (10TH) I WILL GIVE YOU A FREE APPETIZER ....     Deal????? ....."  REALLY!!!!  BRIBE THE CUSTOMERS WITH A FREE APPETIZER So she can  score good reviews after such service  " esto es el colmo del  cinismo"

This was one of the worst experience I have ever experienced at TGI Fridays. I usually drive a little far from my house to a different location, but because of the heavy rain we choose a closer location. Our server was so out of it. We asked her for a fork 3 times before we finally got it 20 mins later after out appetizers came out, because nothing was on our table when we were seated. Half the time the staff didn't know which table ordered which food or drink and went from table to table asking did you order this. There was 3 people at my table and  2 of them received their food to eat, when we was ready to leave my food still did not come out. The manger did refund me for my food and gave me a plate with a piece of chicken, and exactly 5 pieces of pasta. I also had the tomato basil mozzarella and it had 3 tiny pieces of mozzarella with a ton of tomatoes and onions. I thought being in Bayonne it would have been nice, but never again.
Complete bullshit service. I need an ID just to SIT at the bar!? When I was offering out of courtesy to sit there so they wouldn't have to clean a table afterwards? Eff this, heh
This place sucks. Abysmal service. Watered down drinks. TSA of IDs. They spend more time checking IDs than serving customers.
Food is really bland.  And apparently the cooks only know how to cook everything well-done.  Better go next door to Longhorn.
I don't know why but the service was kinda slow and I don't understand why due to it wasn't even a lot of people in the place I always seem to think the appetizers are better then the food

Sooooooo.... This Is my first review and I wish I would've been able to have a better place to have eaten at but oh well...... I usually sit at the bar during football season when I'm watching my NY JETS!!! And always get the garlic parm wing (which are always good) but this time I sat in dining room and it was HORRIBLE! the food was very small portioned and the "waitress" was incompetent oh and really rude did I mention the food was HORRIBLE? and b4 I go the waitress literally moved my chairs and table while I was still seating ....then got upset cause I only tipped 10% and not the 20% she circled??? What a joke! I'm never going back not even football season
Went in, got seated........ Got up and left. No one seemed to care. We didn't even get menus even tho we waited 15 minutes.  Really?

Im writing this review as I'm sitting here on this starving Saturday afternoon. Walked in to grab lunch. Waitress walked by to get us beer and food and seemed of no interest to serve us. I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich and wifey got the chicken fajitas along with the white Apple sangria. Who serves sangria with a million ice cubes in it? While the burger tasted ok ( that's what the one star is for ) it was served cold probably had a 5F temperature. Horrendous. The fajitas were rubbish. Oh the Black beans come cooked in water without any flavor.  They were supposed to serve chipotle glazed chicken but I did not see any such thing on it. The rice was surely Uncle Ben's packaged rice. Totally tasteless and bland. All in all it was the worst tgif I've been to.

Took my wife here .. And she try to order 2 items off the menu. But they were all out it.. Services was horrible!!.. Our server had just brought us our apps and 2 mins later she try to drop off our entires.. Smh...she never asked if we need refills.. Which did !!!.. Im sorry but i will never ever going here again even if its free!!

Ever since this place has opened, my boyfriend and I would return in occasion to try to convince ourselves that we like this place-- or that it'll get better, since they are fairly new, we gave them a few chances to get their kinks out. It never does. It actually gets worse everytime.  We came here last Friday evening. They were holding an event at the bar, no big deal, because we would have liked to sit in the dining area anyway. Well, this event must have thrown off all the servers, because they all looked like they didn't know what they were doing.  Our waiter took our orders. Forgot an appetizer. We decided not to even ask for it since he was already serving our entrees by the time he came our way. He would come to our table in a hurried manner and say "how's the food? Okay great!" Without even giving us a chance to respond or ask for extra napkins, ketchup, etc. The food was also horrible. With the exception of the appetizer. I ordered a medium well steak, which came out well done. It was dry and flavorless. I didn't finish it. The only think that I liked about my meal were the sides -- mashed potatoes and vegetables. Boring.  My boyfriend on the other hand, liked his fried shrimp. I mean, how could you mess those up. But then again, they looked like the same shrimp they serve at Popeyes.  The service was horrible. We'll stick with Houlihan's.

Wow what happened to this place. Food was cold and took 30 mins on a week night to come out. Also they sat us in an awkward booth not a regular one. Our server was very polite but that was probably the best part of our experience. Other than that it was horrible

Staff very annoying! And manager is ver rude. We waited to get a table even though it was completely empty! They ask me for id i gave it to them, my uncle and aunt looks a lot older than me still ask them for id rudely .. i waited for my drink for more than 15 mins ... nothing!!!

This afternoon was the worst display of service I've been through. The only bartender, took her time to serve me, and did not know what a Margarita on the rocks was. Instead she was getting ready to serve me straight up tequila, I say no. I wanted a mixed drink with tequila. The worst of it was waiting 20/25 minutes for a order spinach dip, when the guy next to me got his order before mine; I decided to cancel my order. This was humiliating and pure unprofessional for her serve the guy next to me his food before mine. Watch out when you see one server behind the bar, be ready to get poor service, and a long wait for your food.

Never coming here ever again the girl took forever to take my boyfriend and i's order and then screwed up on my order and got my boyfriends order right and then took forever to bring out the right food

I really don't like to leave a bad review, then suggest another place and say it's better. But in this case I should've just gone to Houlihan's right down the road.  My wife and I decided to stray away from our usual local comfortable Houlihan's bar on a Friday evening to watch a Nets game, have a drink and some food. Why not TGI Fridays? I'll tell you why not. TFIG (The Food Is Gross).  OK OK Maybe not the whole menu but these Jack Daniel offerings are the worst. Ribs are all dry with this JD sauce on the side. Come on!!! Fried Shrimp was not even fried. No crisp. More like thawed already breaded shrimp that was microwaved. The Cole Slaw? Had to spit it back out in my napkin. Some weird seasoning. Not sure what it was. Cole Slaw should just be simple and fresh.  Our waiter was nice though. Offered some extra chips on our cheese dip appetizer. However, never asked if we wanted another drink so we just stuck to water after our first drink. Had to ask another server for utensils once the food was served. Didn't even feel like staying to watch the game.  I felt like we were robbed. 2 mixed drinks 1 app 1 burger 1 ribs & shrimp entree $62 before tip. That's insane for the food quality and service. Lesson learned.

Two stars and I am being generous.  This is the third and the last time for me. The two previous visit we endured issues with the quality of the food and the wait service. This time with two $25.00 gift certificates I figured I could get a free meal. We arrived around 6:30 and the place was not busy.  We were sat at table 21 and we sat there for ten minutes with three waitresses at the ordering station each looking at their individual screens and not one offered any assistance.  I watched a large party be seated and immediately a male waiter began passing out menus.  At this point we had enough.  On my way out I asked to speak to a manager who tried to pologize. But what did catch my attention was one of the waitress who immediately was able to identify the table in question but who never bothered to stop by an offer her assistance to us. But what she did do is throw her fellow employee under the bus.
The food is unbelievable! The brownie obsession is awesome. The waiters are super nice!  On the walls they have cool stuff!
I like to sit at the 'bar area'. Guy forgot my 2nd drink & charged me. But took it off after I told him. Food was good. Service was good. I'm not looking to be hand fed. Just give me good food.

I really have no idea how this place is still in business. God awful service? Check. Disgusting food? Check. Overpriced awful food? Check check. Sad because other locations can actually be decent. But I would advise staying away from this one

Horrible service, dirty utensils, atmosphere wasnt bad. Burger was pretty good. Dont understand how the manager could stand there and let the staff hangout in groups. You will never see me there again
Disgusting food and bad waitressing! I ordered ribs and it was nothing but bones! Also to mention it was even cold! They have slow service even when it isn't even pack

Simply terrible..the hostess sat us where there was a spill on floor that we had to sidestep to get to our seat.  She said someone would come and clean it up.  Well we sat for 10 mins no one came to clean the spill nor did a server ever come to take our order.  We left and went to houlihans

15 minutes just to get greeted by waiter, dirty table, had to grab utensils from another table. No plates for appetizers and a waiter full of excuses. Not the experience one would desire. Couldn't even locate a manager. Won't be back

Worst place to eat around here. Ordered pickup and asked for extra jack Daniels sauce on the side for the jack Daniels burger. Asked twice when I gave my order. Never gave the sauce and the burger was omitted with jack Daniels glaze  too. Fries are pretty sad. Should have gone to five guys.
Menu was falling apart, had to wait more than a while after ordering for my food. However, server was friendly and the steak I ordered was good.

Sunday afternoon, place was nearly empty. I figured OK, I can have a nice lunch with wife after shopping nearby. My wife had suggested SONIC burgers next door but stubborn me, wanted TGIF food.  Why didn't I listen to her?  The service was OK, female server tried very hard and smiled a lot. The food was mediocre at best. I had the Jack Daniel''s Sampler which was over-cooked/.over-fried/ and dry (except the baby back ribs, they were good) wife had the Chicken and Shrimp entree. Don't get hyped up about the sizziling hot plate they bring you. The Chicken was dry, tasteless and  inedible, if there is such a thing as small shrimp, that is what was on the plate. The non-alcoholic drink mamosa lemonade was 3/4 ICE.  an order of fried shrimp and fries came with about 6 small shrimp and medium /cool seemingly leftover french fries.  The check was $65 and I tipped 18% or  $10.00(it is not the server's fault), The "Suggested Tip" is printed on the check.  This place is way over-priced for mediocre food that is NOTHING like the pictures on the menu.  I Will Never Go Back to this TGIF !.

Saddest tgif experience ever. If we're only able to give a negative star grade, then they would get a perfect negative 10. ONE: Gum! There's a gum on the side of the table! How do I know? It's now on my shirt. TWO: Incompetent Server. No follow ups, always takes a while to come, frowned when asked to change a plate of nachos that was mixed with other things, went im the kitchen-just removed the other stuff-wipes his hand on his pants and again no follow ups. THREE: Incompetent Dishwashers. How did we know? Plates that was given to us still have vits and pieces from LOs. Then back to number two, since server should've checked what will be given to their customers. FOUR: We received our order after AN HOUR! Some of the food also came out cold. It was a mistake coming here for dinner. Never again.

Straight up, only come here for apps and drinks during happy hour.  This is just another Franchise restaurant with poor quality food and small portions. But then again you get what you paid for, I mean what more can you expect from a $6 burger. For this location, I have experienced it at night ( can be a mad house sometimes with slow service.) and during the day with good service since it's pretty empty.  Really this review has nothing to do with the staff, they have been friendly so far based off my experiences. It's more of the food that is just not satisfying at all! Do not waste your money on entree meals, you will not be happy. Like I stated above, grab some drinks and appetizers.
Worst ribs on the planet. Other food was over cooked and tasteless. This seems to be a pattern at all their restaurants.

First of all I must say the only reason I made a Yelp account is because how horrible my experience was here. Horrible. Horible. Horible! I remeber when they first opened they were actually pretty good. Would come here twice a month. Then I stopped going after a fowl experience I had with one of the waiters who was just down right rude. Fast forward to November of 2017 my family had thrown a surprise dinner for my birthday and boy was that the biggest mistake ever! The waiter was the worst. No personality. No manners. And wasn't even attentive at all. Whenever someone asked for a refill or for something else on the menu he was just give you this stare as if he wanted to spit on you. My sister got a seafood dish and her lobster smelt horrid! And don't get me started on my dinner...all in all defiantly the LAST time at the Bayonne Friday's and to be honest I don't even know if I want to go to Fridays in general anymore....

I was in Bayonne at lunch time and found this TGIF located in a shopping center. As a well known restaurant chain you usually can't go wrong, so I by passed Yelp reviews. One day I'll learn!!! So I'm alone and I ask for a booth. After a 3 minute walk around the restaurant and passing several empty booths I'm finally seated. I ordered a drink, Strawberry Passion Fruit tea which was really good. No free refill but that's OK because the glass it pretty large. Next I ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken. Oh yes I forgot to mention only two other tables occupied in my section. 20 minutes later my meal finally comes.  Am I too impatient?  I don't think so. It's lunchtime, working people don't have all day. Several places promise short wait times for lunch, but apparently this restaurant didn't get the memo. Well I will say the meal was pretty good and if I were to patronize another TGIF, I'd probably order it again. BTW. Friday's used to have a "Stripes" club. I joined some years ago and apparently they would ask if you were a member and you got points, for what I have no idea. I guess that program fizzled out. That alone says something about Friday's.

Doing a good job of getting their act together. Bar staff more attentive,  food comes quickly, and quality is better also. Stopped coming here for some time because of lacking service and mediocre food quality,  but I'll definitely put it back on my "REGULAR " schrdule.
The service is always slow, it seems the servers just really hate their jobs. Food is never good. I really want to like this place for their happy hour prices, but I keep finding myself disappointed.

It's Sunday and not crowded at all. We've been here an hour and we still havent received our meal. Our server didnt ask what we wanted to drink until 15 min later. I could understand if they were busy but come on. Small businesses who don't have the staff that these giant chains do dish out food quicker.

Truly disappointed. Thursday night and there was only one bartender...how horrible. I felt so bad for the waitress she deserves like a shot after today. Man it wasn't her fault that service was slow and to top it off food was horrendous...I ask for buffalo wings and it was dried with barely any sauce. The salad wasn't even a salad it looked like leftovers. Urgh I didn't want to believe the previous reviews but they are ALL correct. The managers in this place needs to seriously change things because I've been to other TGIF and this is probably tops as the worst.

If you come here you MUST lower your standards immediately before you walk in. This place was not even busy when we walked in. The wait to order something is forever  The wait to get your drinks is an hour away The wait for appetizer is another hour away The wait for your meal is 2 hours later Then when you get your food it's horrendous. My chicken sandwich was fried to a hockey puck. Never ending apps more like never get your app. If you need utensils to eat your food good luck. If you wanted a drink refill its nonexistent .  You wana leave and pay a bill? Where? Who?  Please just close down already its that bad.
Came here at like 10 during saturday night. It was pretty empty. Ordered a ribeye with Jack Daniels Glaze and some boneless bbq eings. Food was delicious. I love THI Fridays steaks.

Bourbon Mahi Mahi. I wish I took a picture of when they first brought it out. Just white pale straight from the sea. The waitress was kind enough to bring it back, but with seasonings that look like they were thrown with no regards to where they landed. Bourbon Mahi Mahi- no good. Waitress was pleasant. Manager was kind enough to discount the plate. That was extremely comforting. Staff can be heard from the kitchen spewing profanity and laughing. Good for them that they're having a good time at work, but as a business where seats are so close to kitchen, decibels should be kept at a minimum. Overall, great customer appreciation, yet not to your food.

Last visit to this place was a disaster!! Service was terrible food was not enjoyable at all! This time we sat at the bar for happy hour and the appetizers were great!! The drinks and the bartender were excellent!! Our server who brought out the food could of cared less and not pleasant at all and would not bring us plates to eat our appetizers on so we used napkins lol but besides that the boneless wings and green bean fries were really good!

Wasn't as satisfied as I usually am. My Jack Daniels wings were delicious, my garlic parmesan wings weren't. Last time ordering those. Our waitress was super busy with lots of tables including some away from our section. She forgot some things, but once I saw how busy she was, it wasn't a problem for us. She was a sweetheart. Wife was happy, kids were happy. Best Long Island Ice Teas my wife and I had in a good while. Will be returning.

This place is a dump. Sadly, no one cares about this establishment. It could've done well for this city if someone actually gave a damn! We literally vomited in our plates. Unsanitary place! Expired food & horrible management. We got food poisoning eating a bad burger with rancid cheese. The so called manager did NOTHING! Called corporate immediately twice! Two days of being ill. Do not chance it by eating here! NOT WORTH YOUR HEALTH!
This place was empty and I go in with my family of 4 and sat at the table for 15 min without being asked our order pr drinks. I got up and walked out !!! Never going back there again

Beyond ridiculous, came to watch the giants game and was told I have to break my neck to watch it.  The Manger stated they have to acomidate other games, mind you the majority of people here are for the giants. Your food or service is not even that great. Just came here for the games now not even that. Thanks

Worst service ever. Late food, some of it never arrive. Poor customer service from the server, he look like he was high on some substance. No utensiles. Managers explanation was that the food would take longer. Not acceptable. Horrible. Will never come here again. I would had given them 0 stars but thats not an option.
